hypothesis_content.title: Elevated Base Gas as a Precursor to SOL Outperformance
hypothesis_content.statement: When Ethereum's 30-day median gas price remains elevated (>40 gwei) for 10 consecutive days during a NEUTRAL market regime, SOL will outperform ETH over the next 10 trading days as users and developers seek lower-fee alternatives.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sustained high gas costs on Ethereum create a tangible user experience and cost problem. In neutral markets where no single narrative dominates, this practical disadvantage can drive incremental capital and attention flow towards primary competitor SOL, boosting its relative performance.
entry_conditions: SOL/ETH ratio is below its 50-day SMA (relative value not overextended)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The 10-day forward SOL/ETH return following the 10-day conditioning period has a mean/median that is not positive and significant.
